key_title: Key to the genera of Fabaceae subfam. Faboideae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the subfamilies of Fabaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: All leaves with a single leaflet, or leaves absent or reduced to scales or spines
All leaves compound with 2 or more leaflets (rarely some leaves with a single leaflet)
Leaves simple or 1-foliolate
Leaves absent or reduced to scales, spines or phyllodes
Leaves simple (not articulated at the petiole-lamina junction)
Leaves 1-foliolate (articulated at petiole-lamina junction)
Stipules present, fused behind the axillary bud (sometimes only at base); bracteoles conspicuous, persistent, attached to, or immediately below, calyx
Stipules free or absent; bracteoles absent, or if present inconspicuous and/or deciduous, attached below calyx
All 10 stamens free or fused only at the very base
All 10 stamens variously fused
Upper 2 calyx teeth fused into a broad notched lip, lower 3 small and narrow; bracteoles prominent, obovate, caducous; pods more or less globose
Combination of features not as above
Ovules more than 2; pods ovoid or obloid; seeds usually more than 2
Ovules 2; pods variously shaped; seeds 1 or 2
Leaves mostly alternate; keel shorter than wings
Leaves mostly opposite, whorled or scattered; keel equal to or longer than wing
Pods divided longitudinally into 2 cells by a false septum projecting from the lower suture; montane shrubs mostly in Eastern Highlands
Pods not as above
Stem-hairs peltate; calyx campanulate; upper 2 calyx teeth valvate, lower 3 teeth successively overlapping upper teeth, teeth recurved at anthesis; seeds not or only palely mottled
Stem-hairs simple; calyx not as above; calyx teeth all valvate, not recurved at anthesis; seeds darkly mottled
Bracts simple; stipules vestigial or absent; inflorescence unbranched
Bracts trilobed; stipules conspicuous; inflorescence branched
[link through]
Pods more or less triangular, glabrous; barren bracts present on peduncle; bracteoles absent
Combination of features not as above
Pods divided longitudinally into 2 cells by a false septum projecting from the lower suture; rare plants of far East Gippsland
Pods not as above
Leaves with recurved or revolute margins; seeds exarillate
Leaves flat with flat to involute margins or terete to trigonous and grooved above; seeds arillate
Bracteoles absent; ovary shortly stipitate
Bracteoles present; ovary sessile
Leaves opposite and decussate, or in whorls of 3 or 4  (rarely opposite in Gastrolobium bilobum)
Leaves alternate, scattered or crowded
Leaves opposite and decussate; stipules absent or minute
Leaves in whorls or 3 or 4 (rarely opposite); stipules 2–6 mm long
Standard slightly longer than broad; inflorescence a terminal head surrounded by an involucre of leaves
Standard much broader than long; inflorescence racemose, umbellate or capitate, not surrounded by an involucre of leaves
All 10 stamens fused in a tube, closed or open on upper side
Upper stamen partially free, other 9 joined in a sheath
Stamens fused in a closed tube
Stamens fused in a sheath open along upper side
Calyx 2-lipped; anthers not bearded
Calyx usually 1-lipped, with small, equal teeth; anthers bearded
[link through]
Leaves distichous; anthers with a perceptible connective, all dorsifixed, uniform
Leaves spirally arranged; anthers with an inconspicuous connective, alternately basifixed and dorsifixed, the latter often shorter
Upper calyx teeth not greatly enlarged, less than 6 times as long as lower teeth; pods not winged above, valves remaining flattish upon dehiscing; leaves alternate or opposite
Upper calyx teeth greatly enlarged, more than 6 times as long as lower teeth; pods with a conspicuous wing above, valves rolling back upon dehiscing; leaves usually opposite
Corolla blue or purple, rarely white; pods not or scarcely longer than broad
Corolla mostly yellow, often with dark red markings; pods at least one and a half times longer than broad
Plants more or less prostrate, herbaceous; pods twisted and somewhat spiny
Plants upright shrubs; pods obloid or elongate, not spiny
[link through]
Branches spinescent; inflorescences 3–8-flowered; pods elongate, indehiscent; seeds exarillate
Branches not spinescent; flowers solitary in leaf axils; pods obloid, dehiscent; seeds arillate
[link through]
[link through]
Stipules conspicuous, adnate to petiole
Stipules free or absent
All 10 stamens fused in a sheath, split (at least basally) along upper side
All or most stamens fused but not as above
Upper calyx teeth not greatly enlarged, less than 6 times as long as lower teeth; pods not winged above, valves remaining flattish upon dehiscing; leaves alternate or opposite
Upper calyx teeth greatly enlarged, more than 6 times as long as lower teeth; pods with a conspicuous wing above, valves rolling back upon dehiscing; leaves usually opposite
All 10 stamens joined in a closed tube; erect shrubs
Upper stamen free, other 9 joined in an open sheath; climbing or prostrate subshrubs
[link through]
Stamens all free
Stamens variously fused
Flowers in very long racemes and panicles; calyx teeth subequal, shorter than calyx tube; pods obovoid, thin-walled, indehiscent
Flowers not arranged as above; calyx teeth unequal, upper 2 united higher up than lower 3, shorter or longer than calyx tube; pods oblique, globose or triangular, thick-walled, dehiscent
[link through]
Flowers in axillary racemes, umbels or reduced to 1 flower; barren bracts present on peduncle; pods more or less triangular
Flowers in terminal or axillary racemes or clusters; barren bracts not present on peduncle; pods more or less globose
All 10 stamens fused in a tube
All 10 stamens fused in a sheath open on upper side or the upper most stamen free
[link through]
Annual herb with grass-like phyllodes
Shrubs or subshrubs; leaves reduced to scales
Branches broadly flattened and winged, apex blunt; pod flat, more than 2 cm long; anthers with a perceptible connective, all dorsifixed, uniform

Branches terete or slightly flattened with a sharply pointed apex; pod more or less swollen, less than 2 cm long; anthers with an inconspicuous connective, alternately basifixed and dorsifixed, the latter often shorter
Leaflets even-numbered, rachis terminated by a simple or pinnate tendril or bristle
Leaflets odd-numbered, rachis terminated by a leaflet
Leaflets usually 5 or more
Leaflets usually 3
Leaves palmately trifoliolate, the 3 petiolules more or less equal
Leaves pinnately trifoliolate, the central petiolule somewhat longer than the laterals
All 10 stamens free; leaves more or less sessile; pods more or less globose
All 10 stamens fused in a closed tube or upper one wholly or partly free
Leaflets gland-dotted, at least on lower surface
Leaflets not gland-dotted
Plants low-growing and herbaceous, sometimes woody at the base
Plants upright shrubs or small trees
Plants twining or trailing, usually woody at the base; flowers usually blue or purplish; inflorescences racemose
Plants prostrate, erect or ascending; flowers usually white, yellow, pink or reddish; inflorescences head-like, spicate or umbellate
Calyx circumscissile, teeth breaking away as flower opens leaving a cup-like remnant; stems spinescent
Calyx and stems not as above
[link through]
Keel oblong, straight along lower surface; style curved abruptly near apex
Keel oblong-falcate, curved along lower surface; style curved throughout
Flowers white or creamish; calyx tubular, c. 10 mm long, 2-lipped, lips about as long as tube; stems terete with obscure ridges
Flowers white or golden-yellow; calyx campanulate, 2–6 mm long, 2-lipped, lips often shorter than tube; stems angular or ribbed
Stipellae clearly present at base of each leaflet
Stipellae minute or absent
Style bearded more than halfway along upper margin
Style glabrous or bearded less than halfway along margin
[link through]
Prostrate, erect or rarely twining herbs; pod transversely jointed, separating into 1-seeded articles
Trailing or twining herbs; pods not as above
Corolla up to c. 10 mm long, mostly blue or purplish; bracteoles present at the base of each pedicel
Corolla more than 10 mm long, mostly red; bracteoles absent
All 10 stamens fused in a sheath split along upper side; pods dehiscent
Stamens usually not as above, but if so pods indehiscent
Margins of leaflets toothed or minutely crenate
Margins of leaflets entire
Pods more or less included in the calyx
Pods greatly exserted from the calyx
Pods usually thick-walled, dehiscent; inflorescences 1- or 2-flowered
Pods black and adhering to the seed, or membranous, indehiscent; inflorescences usually many-flowered
Pods black and adhering to the seed when mature; leaflets gland-dotted, at least on lower surface (sometimes obscured by hairs)
Pods usually membranous; leaflets not gland-dotted
Pods spirally coiled, rarely reniform or falcate, often spiny or tuberculate
Pods not as above
Pods globose or ovoid, straight, indehiscent; flowers in elongated racemes
Pods long, linear, curved, tardily dehiscent; flowers in axillary clusters
[link through]
Inflorescences racemose; pods exserted from calyx
Inflorescences of few-flowered axillary clusters; pods included in calyx
[link through]
All 10 stamens free
All 10 stamens variously fused by their filaments
Anthers tipped by a small raised gland
Anthers not as above
Combination of features not as above
Plants herbaceous; leaves mostly 5-foliolate, upper 3 palmate at apex of rachis, lower 2 at base of rachis and often resembling stipules; stipules minute
All 10 stamens fused in a sheath open along upper side; pods dehiscent
Stamens not as above
Leaves imparipinnate; calyx not 2-lipped; pods linear-cylindric
Leaves usually palmately 5–15-foliolate; calyx deeply 2-lipped; pods oblong, compressed
[link through]
Stipules becoming enlarged and spinose; deciduous trees
Stipules not becoming spinose; herbs and shrubs
[link through]
Styles bearded
Styles glabrous or pubescent near base only
Standard shorter than keel; flowers more than 3 cm long; medium shrubs
Standard equal to or longer than keel; flowers mostly less than 3 cm long; herbs or subshrubs
[link through]
Leaves mostly palmately 5-foliolate
Leaves imparipinnate
Leaflets more or less terete
Leaflets flat
[link through]
Terminal leaflet much larger than laterals; pods included in the calyx
Terminal leaflet not larger than laterals; pods exserted from the calyx
[link through]
Pods with 1-several seeds, not transversely jointed
Mature pods transversely jointed, separating into 1-seeded articles
Leaflet margins toothed; pods inflated, mostly 2-seeded
Leaflet margins entire; pods not inflated, 1–6-seeded
Pods discoid, 1-seeded, reticulate with bristly margins; corolla pink with red or purple veins
Pods ovoid, cylindric or linear-oblong, 1–6-seeded, smooth or covered with bristles; corolla white, yellow, blue or purplish
Pods more or less cylindric, c. 6-seeded, smooth, curved; corolla pale yellow
Pods ovoid and bristly or linear-oblong and smooth, 1–6-seeded; corolla white, blue or purplish
Keel acute or beaked; pods linear, markedly 4-angled
Keel obtuse; pods terete or compressed, not 4-angled
[link through]
Inflorescences of erect many-flowered racemes; corolla more than 10 mm long, reddish; pods covered with sharp rough projections
Inflorescences of few-flowered axillary clusters or umbels; corolla less than 10 mm long, flowers white, yellow or pink; pods reticulate
Inflorescence a many-flowered head; standard white or pink; keel dark red, not beaked; leaflets dimorphic
Plants lacking the above combination of characters; keel always beaked (sometimes obscurely so)
Stipules similar in appearance and size to leaflets (or larger)
Stipules smaller and narrower than leaflets
Leaflets 2
Leaflets 4-many
Climbing or procumbent to erect herbs, usually less than 1 m high; leaf rachis terminating in a tendril
Erect herbs or shrubs to 3 m high; leaf rachis terminating in a bristle
[link through]
